org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge

Class VeluxBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridge
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonVeluxBridge, SlipVeluxBridge

    @NonNullByDefault
public abstract class VeluxBridge
extends java.lang.Object
    2nd Level I/O interface towards the Velux bridge. It provides methods for pre- and post-communication as well as a common method for the real communication. The following class access methods exist:
    • bridgeLogin() for pre-communication,
    • bridgeLogout() for post-communication,
    • bridgeCommunicate(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.common.BridgeCommunicationProtocol, boolean) as method for the common communication.

    Each protocol-specific implementation provides a publicly visible set of supported protocols as variable supportedProtocols. As root of several inheritance levels it predefines an interfacing method bridgeAPI() which has to be implemented by any kind of protocol-specific communication returning the appropriate base (1st) level communication method as well as any other gateway interaction with bridgeDirectCommunicate(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.common.BridgeCommunicationProtocol, boolean).

    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

      • supportedProtocols

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> supportedProtocols
        Support protocols for the concrete implementation.

        For protocol-specific implementations this value has to be adapted along the inheritance i.e. with the protocol-specific class values.

      • authenticationToken

        protected java.lang.String authenticationToken
        BridgeCommunicationProtocol authentication token for Velux Bridge.

        protected VeluxBridgeInstance bridgeInstance
        Handler to access global bridge instance methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • VeluxBridge

        public VeluxBridge(VeluxBridgeInstance bridgeInstance)
        Constructor.

        Initializes the binding-wide instance for dealing with common informations and the Velux bridge connectivity settings by preparing the configuration settings with help by VeluxBridgeConfiguration.

        Parameters:
        bridgeInstance - refers to the binding-wide instance for dealing for common informations like existing actuators and predefined scenes.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Destructor.

        Deinitializes the binding-wide instance.

      • isAuthenticated

        private boolean isAuthenticated()
        Determines whether the binding is already authenticated against the bridge so that any other communication can occur without an additional care about authentication.

        This method automatically decides on availability of the stored authentication information authenticationToken whether a (re-)authentication is possible.

        Returns:
        true if the bridge is authenticated; false otherwise.

      • resetAuthentication

        protected void resetAuthentication()
        Declares the binding as unauthenticated against the bridge so that the next communication will take care about (re-)authentication.

      • bridgeLogin

        public boolean bridgeLogin()
        Prepare an authorization request and communicate it with the Velux veluxBridge. If login is successful, the returned authorization token will be stored within this class for any further communication via up to an authorization with method bridgeLogout().
        Returns:
        true if the login was successful, and false otherwise.

      • bridgeLogout

        public boolean bridgeLogout()
        Prepare an authenticated deauthorization request and communicate it with the Velux veluxBridge. The authorization token stored in this class will be destroyed, so that the next communication has to start with bridgeLogin().
        Returns:
        true if the logout was successful, and false otherwise.

      • bridgeCommunicate

        private boolean bridgeCommunicate(BridgeCommunicationProtocol communication,
                                  boolean useAuthentication)
        Initializes a client/server communication towards Velux veluxBridge based on the Basic I/O interface VeluxBridge and parameters passed as arguments (see below) and provided by VeluxBridgeConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        communication - the intended communication, that is request and response interactions as well as appropriate URL definition.
        useAuthentication - whether to use authenticated communication.
        Returns:
        true if communication was successful, and false otherwise.

      • bridgeCommunicate

        public boolean bridgeCommunicate(BridgeCommunicationProtocol communication)
        Initializes a client/server communication towards Velux Bridge based on the Basic I/O interface VeluxBridge and parameters passed as arguments (see below) and provided by VeluxBridgeConfiguration. This method automatically decides to invoke a login communication before the intended request if there has not been an authentication before.
        Parameters:
        communication - the intended communication, that is request and response interactions as well as appropriate URL definition.
        Returns:
        true if communication was successful, and false otherwise.

      • lastCommunication

        public long lastCommunication()
        Returns the timestamp in milliseconds since Unix epoch of last communication.

        If possible, it should be overwritten by protocol specific implementation.

        Returns:
        timestamp (default zero).

      • lastSuccessfulCommunication

        public long lastSuccessfulCommunication()
        Returns the timestamp in milliseconds since Unix epoch of last successful communication.

        If possible, it should be overwritten by protocol specific implementation.

        Returns:
        timestamp (default zero).

      • bridgeAPI

        public abstract BridgeAPI bridgeAPI()
        Provides information about the base-level communication method and any kind of available gateway interaction.

        For protocol-specific implementations this method has to be overwritten along the inheritance i.e. with the protocol-specific class implementations.

        Returns:
        bridgeAPI of type BridgeAPI.

      • bridgeDirectCommunicate

        protected abstract boolean bridgeDirectCommunicate(BridgeCommunicationProtocol communication,
                                                   boolean useAuthentication)
        Initializes a client/server communication towards Velux veluxBridge based on the protocol-specific implementations with common parameters passed as arguments (see below) and provided by VeluxBridgeConfiguration.

        For protocol-specific implementations this method has to be overwritten along the inheritance i.e. with the protocol-specific class implementations.

        Parameters:
        communication - Structure of interface type BridgeCommunicationProtocol describing the intended communication.
        useAuthentication - boolean flag to decide whether to use authenticated communication.
        Returns:
        success of type boolean which signals the success of the communication.
